context.p: Customers can explicitly start and stop a VM in vSphere from as well as create and restore snapshots. To do this, they execute the appropriate service operation from the subscription for the VM:

ul.li: Start: Starts the VM if it was stopped.
Stop: Stops the VM if it was started.
Restart: Shuts down the VM in vSphere and starts it again.
Snapshot: Creates a snapshot of the VM. Be aware that no snapshot versions are stored. When a new snapshot is created, the previous one is overwritten.
Restore: Resets the VM to a previously created snapshot.
